brewery.name: Baere Brewing Company
brewery.description: An industrial farmhouse in the Historic Baker District of Denver.

brewery.name: Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project
brewery.description: Crooked Stave is a progressive, artisan brewery that strives to blend brewing science and art, through creativity and following our passion. We are based in Denver, Colorado while the unique beers we produce draw inspiration from worldly adventures. All our beers are produced from the highest quality ingredients, using contemporary and historic brewing techniques aimed at evolving ones perception of what beer is and focused on delivering the best possible drinking experience.

brewery.name: Beryl's Beer Co.
brewery.description: Beryl's Beer Co. is dedicated to delivering high quality barrel aged beers to the local community.

data.name: Blue Moon Brewing Company at the SandLot
data.hoursOfOperation: Now only open during Rockies home games.

brewery.name: Blue Moon Brewing Company
brewery.description: At Blue Moon Brewing Company®, we believe brewing is an art. And it’s been that way since our head brewmaster and founder, Keith Villa, first created Blue Moon® Belgian White Belgian-Style Wheat Ale back in 1995 in downtown Denver, Colorado.

brewery.name: Breckenridge Brewery
brewery.description: Breckenridge Brewery was founded in 1990 in Breckenridge, Colorado. In the past two plus decades Breckenridge Brewery has grown from a small 3,000-barrels-a-year brewpub to one of the most successful craft beer and restaurant companies in the nation. It now handcrafts more than 70,000 barrels of fresh beer annually and owns and operates five brewpubs and ale houses in the state of Colorado. For more information visit www.breckbrew.com.

brewery.name: Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project
brewery.description: Crooked Stave is a progressive, artisan brewery that strives to blend brewing science and art, through creativity and following our passion. We are based in Denver, Colorado while the unique beers we produce draw inspiration from worldly adventures. All our beers are produced from the highest quality ingredients, using contemporary and historic brewing techniques aimed at evolving ones perception of what beer is and focused on delivering the best possible drinking experience.

brewery.name: The ChopHouse & Brewery
brewery.description: As a popular gathering place, our pride is in serving American steakhouse classics, paired with the city’s finest handcrafted beers brewed on site. But we are much more than a steakhouse, offering a great experience at an affordable price, with hand-cut chops, fresh seafood and an extensive wine list, all in a unique turn of the century bank transformed into one of Washington’s hot spots.

brewery.name: Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery
brewery.description:
Our brewers eat, drink and sleep beer. They’re equal parts scientist, artist and beer geek. So, while every Rock Bottom brewer is passionate about their craft, they also put their own signature into every beer.

In other words, there is a unique beer menu at every Rock Bottom in addition to our core line up of consistent flavor profiles that you can expect at any Rock Bottom you visit nationwide.

But, you’re thirsty and want to know what beers you can expect down here, right?

brewery.name: Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery
brewery.description:
Our brewers eat, drink and sleep beer. They’re equal parts scientist, artist and beer geek. So, while every Rock Bottom brewer is passionate about their craft, they also put their own signature into every beer.

In other words, there is a unique beer menu at every Rock Bottom in addition to our core line up of consistent flavor profiles that you can expect at any Rock Bottom you visit nationwide.

But, you’re thirsty and want to know what beers you can expect down here, right?

brewery.name: Breckenridge Brewery
brewery.description: Breckenridge Brewery was founded in 1990 in Breckenridge, Colorado. In the past two plus decades Breckenridge Brewery has grown from a small 3,000-barrels-a-year brewpub to one of the most successful craft beer and restaurant companies in the nation. It now handcrafts more than 70,000 barrels of fresh beer annually and owns and operates five brewpubs and ale houses in the state of Colorado. For more information visit www.breckbrew.com.

brewery.name: Goldspot Brewing Company
brewery.description: Goldspot Brewing is in the Berkeley neighborhood, about a block from Regis University.  Named for the gold spot that symbolizes the sun on both the city and state flags, Goldspot features several core beers made on a seven-barrel system, including an IPA, an imperial oatmeal stout and a wheat beer, along with rotating seasonals.

brewery.name: Hogshead Brewery
brewery.description: Hogshead Brewery and Tap Room has been designed and developed to provide a variety of beers with an emphasis on English ales in a warm and inviting atmosphere with a neighborhood friendly feel. The Slo-Hi location was developed to allow a local clientele, as well as beer aficionados and lovers of good times a central spot in Denver to enjoy a proper pint and have a chat. We will always have three to four great beers on tap via CO2 pressurized kegs and plan to maintain properly conditioned Real Ale from naturally carbonated casks served from beer engines for those that enjoy this traditional British libation. The brewing system and associated cellar has been custom designed with an integrated control system, that allow the brewer to process from one to ten barrels in a batch process and ferment in temperature controlled Stainless Steel vessels. Each of the beers have been formulated from carefully selected malted barley, treated water, multiple varieties of hops, and a specific yeast strain to produce the flavor, mouth-feel, alcohol content, aroma and bitterness, as well as the complex flavor profile according to the time and temperature recipe intended by the brewer. In addition to the attention to detail required for consistent and repeatable brews the brewmaster and support personnel follow a disciplined regiment of cleaning manually, and automatically with Clean-In-Place Systems (CIP) to exclude off-flavors, contaminants, and other undesirables in our beers. Every beer we serve has been naturally processed without the assistance of filtration which is why we are intensely focused on the highest quality ingredients, temperature controls, and finish aging to serve a quality product that we hope you enjoy as much as we do.

brewery.name: Lowdown Brewery + Kitchen
brewery.description:
LowDown is the culmination of 20+ years of professional brewing experience. LowDown owners Scott and Phil have won numerous awards, including accolades from The Great American Beer Festival.  We don’t just stop at great beer, we serve great food too.  We only serve the best seasonal menu items with quality ingredients.

LowDown understands what it means to give back. We know that we reside in a neighborhood many people call home. Making our neigborhood and everything around it better is part of our mission.

From our casual environment to educating our staff, we're redefining the brewery experience. At LowDown we're passionate about quality beer, great and sustainable food, and making memories with good friends.

brewery.name: Station 26 Brewing Co.
brewery.description:
Denver fire station turned brewery + taproom

5280's 2014 "Best New Brewery" 

Westword's 2014 "Best Taproom - Ambience"

brewery.name: Bierstadt Lagerhaus
brewery.description: New brewery in progress in Denver, CO.

brewery.name: Creede Brewing Company
brewery.description: Brewery, Brew pub and Tap Room.

brewery.name: Tivoli Brewing
brewery.description: The Tivoli Beer story traces its roots to 1864, when German immigrant Moritz Sigi founded a brewery in the newly settled town of Denver. Taken over in 1900 by John Good and renamed Tivoli, this brewery would become one of the largest breweries in the West, selling its light golden lager nearly everywhere west of the Mississippi until closing its doors in 1969. In 2012, a group of Colorado Natives formed the Tivoli Distributing Company to bring this Colorado legend back to life.

brewery.name: CO-Brew
brewery.description:
CO Brew is Denver's only homebrew supply store, small-scale brewery, and brew on premises experience. Denver metro homebrewers looking for a full selection of grains, hops, yeast and equipment will appreciate our convenient location at 11th & Broadway in Central Denver.

Brew on premises is a unique opportunity to learn to brew or to improve your brewing skills using professional-grade equipment. If you live in a small space and do not have room to brew or store brewing equipment, want to learn how to brew, or simply enjoy having fun and want to brew with friends, brew on premises is perfect for you. In addition, we will handle all of the set-up and messy clean-up.

brewery.name: Colorado Cider Company
brewery.description: The Colorado Cider Company was founded to produce a fresh hard cider for the discerning Colorado drinker. With a well-developed craft beer market and an educated populace Hard Cider has been a missing choice in the cacophony of craft drinks in local pubs and liquor stores. We hope to remedy that. We're getting out in the market, check out our "Find us" page!

brewery.name: Renegade Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Offensively Delicious? Yes, that’s what our beer is. Always creative and always packed with flavor. This is beer for those who do the don’ts and don’t the dos, the Renegades. We don’t care about traditional styles, or following the trends, we care about making f’ing delicious beer that we are proud to serve.

Renegade was founded by Brian and Khara O’Connell in the summer of 2011 in the Santa Fe Arts District of Denver. Brian brought his offensively delicious brews, developed in his backyard, to Denverites to encourage social interaction and friendship.  Come down to our taproom, or ask for us at your favorite bar, restaurant or liquor store. Whatever you do, don’t be something you’re not.Be Renegade.

brewery.name: C Squared Ciders
brewery.description: C Squared Ciders is a Denver based craft cidery, located in the thriving downtown RiNo arts district.  We create the highest quality ciders from the finest ingredients that appeal not only to ourselves, but to a range of craft beverage fans.  Craft is a great word to describe what we do at the cidery and one of the things we enjoy about our business. The name C Squared symbolizes our commitment to take cider making to the next level, in terms of both the mainstream acceptance of cider and what cider can become. To do this, we are combining our decades of craft brewing experience with cider and winemaking techniques to bring new flavors to the world of cider.

brewery.name: Seedstock Brewery
brewery.description: Seedstock Brewing Company creates simple and unique beers rooted in history, but balanced by the diversity of Americana.

brewery.name: TRVE Brewing Company
brewery.description: TRVE Brewing is the Denver brewery dedicated to bringing you beer that's beyond the pale. A neighborhood spot where you can hang out and have some killer beer.

brewery.name: Copper Kettle Brewing Company
brewery.description: Copper Kettle Brewing Company is a locally owned Mom and Pop brewery, established in 2011. Built on the foundation of craft beer, quality ingredients and the idea of re-creating the local neighborhood pub feel that America seems to have lost. Come on in and enjoy a pint or two and take a growler home with you to share with your friends and family

brewery.name: De Steeg Brewing
brewery.description: De Steeg Brewing - A micro brewery in the Highlands providing quality craft beers to the Metro Denver beer enthusiasts.

brewery.name: Spangalang Brewery
brewery.description: Spangalang Brewery is a destination brewery located in Five Points Colorado.

brewery.name: Black Shirt Brewing Company
brewery.description: An artisanal brewing company that combines classic and timeless technique coupled with progressive innovation and unwavering commitment to quality to create the very pinnacle of beer. Our hand-crafted, hand-bottled beer will be available in fine restaurants and select retail establishments soon.

data.name: Main Brewery

Fri - Sat: 11:00 am - 2:00 am

brewery.name: Black Sky Brewery
brewery.description: Beer.Pizza.Metal. Black Sky has 23 taps featuring in-house and guest brews, and serves a distinct New Haven Style Pizza. Daily lunch specials and happy hours!

brewery.name: Chain Reaction Brewing Company
brewery.description: With every action there is a reaction. For us a strong foundation of dedication to trades such as mechanics, ironwork and carpentry was laid early in life. With the love of these trades the need to create was always a must and that is what brings us to this point of wanting to share our beers with the public. We never focus on pleasing just one style since we love just about all of them and while not every beer we brew will be the perfect student in its category it will be one that will get the craft beer loving palate craving more with each sip.

brewery.name: Ratio Beerworks
brewery.description:
When it comes to beer, consistency is king. That’s why we have anchored our lineup with four meticulously crafted flagship brews.

In addition to the staples, we set the brewers loose on seasonal and artisanal options on a rotating basis. Our barrel aging and firkin programs will let us test and refine our more ambitious offerings.

We learned how to drink on tour. We learned how to brew in Germany.

In many ways, Ratio started in the punk scene back in the late 90’s. We cut our teeth by touring, playing out, creating zines, and working at labels. That DIY mindset prepared us for the challenges of creating and sharing our passions on our own terms. Over the years that energy has been channeled into brewing, learning the craft in Germany and honing our skills at some of the most respected breweries in Colorado. After moving on to successful careers in brewing, marketing, and finance; we have teamed up again for our most ambitious project yet - Ratio Beerworks.

With a state of the art 20 barrel system, we will have more than enough beer to go around. And the tap room will be as eclectic as the community that it’s built to support. The scene at Ratio is all about beer, but our art and music programs will ensure all of the senses are stimulated.

data.name: Main Brewery

Fri - Sat: 12:00 pm - 9:00 pm

brewery.name: Strange Craft Beer Company
brewery.description: Strange Brewing Company, opened in May of 2010, was Denver's first successful nanobrewery, brewing on a one-barrel homebrew setup. Though we have expanded to a 10bbl system, we kept our original setup and brew a 1bbl experimental every Wednesday. With 12 taps in our Tasting Room, you're sure to find something you like.

brewery.name: Bull & Bush Pub & Brewery
brewery.description:
In 1971, casting aside their stockbroker careers to become the bellwether personalities of the Denver restaurant industry in the 70s and 80s, the brothers built the Bull & Bush to kick start a list of successful restaurants.

Last but certainly not least, the pub is now also a brewery. Since brewing its first batch on New Year’s Day of 1997, the Bull & Bush brewing operation has become world renowned for its great tasting and innovative creations. Master Brewer Gabe Moline’s brews have earned multiple accolades including the Best Beer in a Brewpub award in Westword‘s Best of Denver, multiple awards at the annual Denver-hosted Great American Beer Festival (GABF) and most recently the Bull and Bush’s “The Legend of the Liquid Brain Imperial Stout” was given the highest honor, a Gold award, at the World Beer Cup – the world’s largest commercial beer competition.

brewery.name: Little Machine Beer
brewery.description: New brewery, founded by industry veterans, in the Jefferson Park neighborhood of Denver.

brewery.name: 14er Brewing Company
brewery.description: Diploma in Denver. Bachelors in Mountains. Doctorate in Craft Beer. #UniquelyCrushable #HowWeClimb

We will always have three to four great beers on tap via CO2 pressurized kegs and plan to maintain properly conditioned Real Ale from naturally carbonated casks served from beer engines for those that enjoy this traditional British libation.

brewery.name: Del Norte Brewing Company
brewery.description: Del Norte is the only U.S. brewer specializing in authentic Mexican-style beers. Brewed locally in small batches with traditional ingredients, our beers capture the styles and flavor of the oldest brewing heritage in the Western Hemisphere.

brewery.name: River North Brewery
brewery.description: Independent family-owned Denver brewery crafting Adventure Fuel for the state of Colorado.

brewery.name: Crazy Mountain Brewing
brewery.description: Crazy Mountain Brewing Company was founded in January 2010 by Kevin and Marisa Selvy in the heart of the Rocky Mountains.  After a chance meeting in the Anchor Brewing Tasting Room, Kevin and Marisa decided to follow their crazy dreams and move to Colorado, Kevin's home state, and brew.  With a combined passion for craft beer, Kevin and Marisa founded the Vail Valley’s first production brewery.  Crazy Mountain was built with love from the ground up in a gutted warehouse, shipping in tanks and equipment from around the globe. Their first beer was poured at a beer festival in Vail in January 2010.  Using the highest quality ingredients, Crazy Mountain handcrafts each brew for beer enthusiasts across the United States, Japan, Hong Kong, and Sweden.  We say crazy is as crazy does, so drink up and live the life you want!

brewery.name: Factotum Brewhouse
brewery.description:
Mission Statement: Factotum Brewhouse assists homebrewers in creating a highly-drinkable product by providing professional brewing equipment, guidance and education, and a beer-loving community defined by mutual support, unbiased opinion, and a philosophy that anybody can brew.

Who we are: We are a sibling-owned brewhouse in the Sunnyside neighborhood of Denver. Our German-American upbringing has instilled in us a passion for beer and our background as professional educators compels us to impart our brewing knowledge to the community.

The brewhouse: Factotum Brewhouse is a brewery for the people, by the people. The drinks you enjoy in our taproom were conceived and created by homebrewers and other beer lovers under the tutelage of our head brewer in an effort to guide and teach our customers in the art of making great beer. Drink a beer, make a beer—at Factotum Brewhouse, the choice is yours.

brewery.name: Grandma's House
brewery.description:
Colorado has long been the center of the craft beer movement, and with a new Colorado brewery to visit seemingly every week, that movement is in full swing. We hope to serve as a launchpad for the next generation of Colorado beer. In addition to our own beers, Grandma's House allows other aspiring breweries the opportunity to create their beers on our brewing system and sell them through the taproom. Our guests enjoy an ever-changing tap list from multiple breweries all producing under the same roof.

As Grandma's House has progressed from concept toward reality, we've had the pleasure of visiting craft events all over the Denver area and have been blown away by the diverse community of artisans right here in our own backyard. We aspire to become one small part of this community and help it to grow. Grandma's House will showcase the amazing products made by small producers right here in Colorado. We will partner with other craft-related businesses for regular events at the brewery

brewery.name: Good River Beer Company
brewery.description: Good River Beer is a craft brewer based in Denver, CO.  Our mission is "to share our inspirational beers and protect and conserve rivers."  Good River Beer will provide a variety of cutting edge, niche beers nationwide and through our efforts give back a percentage of our profits to river conservation efforts.

brewery.name: Broken Spine Brewing
brewery.description:
Broken Spine Brewing is a brewery-in-planning co-founded by husband and wife brewers, Adam Frank and Emily Thomason. Each recipe, as well as each batch, is handcrafted by the pair. They believe good beer tells a story. 

At this time, Broken Spine's beer will be available on tap in Denver through a guest brewing partnership, so you will have the opportunity to grab a pint before they open. While still in the early stages of planning, it is their intention to open a microbrewery at a location still to be determined in the west by Q1 2016.

If you would like to become involved in some way, please reach out!

brewery.name: Platt Park Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Platt Park Brewery and Taproom was designed and developed to provide Denver and its surrounding areas with craft Ales and Lagers, with a focus on quality and not quantity. Platt Park Brewing Company is located in the historic Platt Park neighborhood at 1875 S. Pearl Street Denver, CO 80201. The tasting room attached to the production facility is filled with large community tables and board games to spark conversation while you enjoy award winning craft beers.

brewery.name: Dixon's Downtown Grill
brewery.description: (No longer brewing)

brewery.name: Our Mutual Friend Malt & Brew
brewery.description:
Our Mutual Friend is a brewery and taproom located in the Five Points neighborhood of Denver. For us, brewing beer began as an excuse to gather with our friends and ruminate on life, philosophy, music, food, and of course, beer. Once we got started, we grew more curious about the brewing process, honing our craft and experimenting with different methods and techniques. Along the way a fundamental question to our process was, how can we do more of this ourselves? Our desire to participate in every step of the grain to glass process led us to open Our Mutual Friend.

At OMF, our goal is to use local sources to brew local ales. This is why we malt and roast as much of the grain we use in our beer as we can. As a small maltstery, we have more influence over the quality and freshness of the beers we pour in our taproom, and more opportunities to source our ingredients locally. 100 percent of our barley is grown right here in Colorado. And as much as possible, we source our hops and specialty ingredients from farms in our state. 

Part of what we love about beer is its power to bring people together (hence our name!). We’re excited to be a gathering place in the Five Points neighborhood where locals and visitors alike can meet in camaraderie alongside a quality pint of ale. We believe in the power of neighborly acts and the spirit of neighbors taking care of one another within the local community. We at OMF support and strive for the Denver community to know each other better and enjoy a good pint in the same process. 

We are excited to see our city developing a local, world-class brewery community, and look forward to building relationships with our friends and neighbors, and collaborating with other breweries to cherish our Denver home and protect our collective local influence.

brewery.name: Cerebral Brewing
brewery.description: Cerebral Brewing is a neighborhood brewery in the Bluebird District of Denver, Colorado. Our goal is to combine scientific methodology with an artistic viewpoint to create extremely drinkable beers spanning a broad spectrum of styles.

brewery.name: Denver Beer Company
brewery.description:
Denver Beer Co. was born in our garages with a few batches of homebrew and a love for the craft of brewing. Serving only premium artisan ales and lagers, we utilize fresh ingredients and embrace both innovative and old world styles of beer. Similar to a farmer’s table, our beer selections change with the seasons. By brewing in small batches, we can ensure that a few old favorites are always on tap, but new goodies greet visitors each month.

Our brewery is founded on passion for high quality, flavorfully crafted beer and the belief that the best pints are those shared with good company. Drawing inspiration from beer gardens of Bavaria, we designed Denver Beer Co. to be a place where new and old friends can share a table and pint out of doors.

brewery.name: Alpine Dog Brewing Company
brewery.description: Alpine Dog is a term coined for Coloradans. While we do love our dogs, this term goes deeper than that. It is a reflection of the people. In Colorado we love the mountains. It's where we go to play; it's where we go to exercise, relax, make friends and have fun getting away. Whether its crushing single track on a mountain bike, tearing up the slopes on skis or a snowboardi, hiking one of CO's 54 1...See More

brewery.name: Caution Brewing Company
brewery.description: Closest microbrewery to DIA, CAUTION is Denver's premier speciality brewery. Hand crafted, unusually balanced beers are made with amazing and local ingredients. Isn't it time you stopped by?

brewery.name: Declaration Brewing Company
brewery.description: Dedicated to constantly challenging what is possible in craft beer, Declaration Brewing Company will strive to write its own chapter in the celebrated history that humanity and beer share.  Through continual evolution of the status quo, Declaration Brewing Company aims to expand upon established craft beer culture, practices, and expectations.

brewery.name: Prost Brewing Company
brewery.description:
The Brewery was made by the Ziemann GmbH in 1963. It was installed at the Bucher Bräu in the German city of Grafenau and used there until 1984. In 1984 it was overhauled and sold to Brauerei Hümmer of Breitengüßbach, Germany, a village in the Franconian region of Bavaria.

Brauerei Hümmer started brewing beer in the Franconian village of Breitengüßbach in 1642. The brewery served the town for over 350 years until the spring of 2011. It made several styles including Altfränkisches Dunkel Bier, a rare specialty beer that we will revive in Denver.

brewery.name: Former Future Brewing Company
brewery.description: Former, meet Future.  It’s simple, really.  We take historical recipes, deconstruct them, and place our own futuristic interpretation into them.  We reconstruct them, but in ways you may not expect.  Our taproom displays our brewing process from laboratory to tap.  The Former Future staff is service and beer focused.  All of our friendly, down-to-Earth employees are certified by the Cicerone program and are card-carrying beer geeks.

brewery.name: Jagged Mountain Brewery
brewery.description: Jagged Mountain Craft Brewery is a unique, innovative, and distinctive brewery based out of Denver, Colorado.

brewery.name: Lost Highway Brewing Company
brewery.description: Belgium's oldest tradition comes to Colfax!

brewery.name: Great Divide Brewing Company
brewery.description:
These beers have landed an impressive amount of acclaim: Great Divide beers have earned 18 Great American Beer Festival medals and 5 World Beer Cup awards. Great Divide was also ranked 8th in Ratebeer.com’s 2010 “The Best Brewers in the World” and was ranked 7th in Beer Advocate’s 2009 “All-Time Top Breweries on Planet Earth.”

But why take their word for it? Crack open a bottle and decide for yourself.

brewery.name: Wit's End Brewing Company
brewery.description: We are an artisanal Denver brewery fueled by dreams and inspired by the limitless potential of craft beer since 2011…Join us on our journey!

brewery.name: FERMÆNTRA
brewery.description: FERMÆNTRA is a 7bbl brewery that produces bold, artful, inspired craft beer. We are located in the University area at 1715 East Evans Avenue, in Denver, Colorado. Our brews are rooted in traditional style, yet amplified to embody the evolution of American craft beer.

brewery.name: Comrade Brewing Company
brewery.description: Welkome to the Party.  That's the motto for Comrade Brewing Company in southeast Denver.  Comrade features "back-to-basics" beers and a tongue-in-cheek nod to Communism.  But the name actually celebrates the camaraderie the craft brewing industry has become known for.

brewery.name: Great Divide Brewing Company
brewery.description:
These beers have landed an impressive amount of acclaim: Great Divide beers have earned 18 Great American Beer Festival medals and 5 World Beer Cup awards. Great Divide was also ranked 8th in Ratebeer.com’s 2010 “The Best Brewers in the World” and was ranked 7th in Beer Advocate’s 2009 “All-Time Top Breweries on Planet Earth.”

But why take their word for it? Crack open a bottle and decide for yourself.

brewery.name: Bruz Beers
brewery.description:
Bruz Beers is Denver's artisanal Belgian-style brewery, featuring a full line of
traditional and Belgian-inspired brews, hand-crafted in small batches.

brewery.name: Wynkoop Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Colorado’s first brewpub, Wynkoop Brewing Company was founded in 1988 by a group of young entrepreneurs and urban pioneers led by Denver's current Governor John Hickenlooper.

Our brewpub’s hallmarks -- highly acclaimed small-batch beers, high quality food & service, the city’s best pool hall and our glorious 1888 building -- helped make us a major catalyst for the revival of Lower Downtown Denver.

Today Wynkoop Brewing Company is a beer-blessed Denver institution, a must-visit Colorado landmark and one of the nation’s most revered craft breweries.

We’re also one of the city’s best places for private and corporate events. We’ve hosted everything from the Democratic National Convention parties to beer festivals, weddings and company conferences. (All with great beer and food.)

Today we’re expanding our downtown brewing efforts to deliver more of our ambitious, artisan-style craft beer to Denver’s best beer outlets. Look for cans of our beer in local stores and kegs of all of our beers at the area’s top bars and restaurants.

brewery.name: Black Project
brewery.description:
At Black Project, we focus crafting unique, delicious beers through research and development in spontaneous fermentation.

Black Project is the personal passion project of James Howat, owner and brewmaster of Former Future Brewing Company. Black Project began production in January 2014 and won bronze medals for coolship ales (Category: Experimental, Subcategory: Wild Ales) at The Great American Beer Festival 2014 and 2015. 

All of our beers are fermented with microbes captured from the local environment via our coolship. We believe this creates a beer that is unrivaled in complexity. Our beers are intended to have a sense of place, terroir, no matter how hard one tried our beer could not be replicated outside of our brewery. In fact, our microbe cultures are purposefully allowed to evolve from batch to batch, creating variations and interesting twists from different releases of the same beer. 

We are meticulous about designing recipes and processes that will allow nature to take over and create beers unrivaled in their beauty and complexity. Through experimentation and research we are continuously developing new and different techniques for use with wild and spontaneous fermentation.

We are not and do not have any intention of being a lambic brewery. We use science and experimentation to find which processes and ingredients we want to use that parallel traditional lambic producers, however - other the the use of a coolship - we maintain no strict adherence to tradition for tradition's sake. Spontaneous fermentation is merely a starting point and core of our process, from there James's research and development extends much beyond the scope of the great Belgian brewers and blenders. 

Our wort is predominantly produced on FFBC's 4bbl brewhouse, and our coolship beers are inoculated on the roof. As of January 2016 our barrel and aging program is housed at Former Future, but we are currently planning to move all Black Project barrels to a second facility in order to allow for growth of both Black Project and Former Future.

brewery.name: Mockery Brewing Co.
brewery.description: Mockery Brewing is a craft brewery that focuses on bold flavors while maintaining the utmost respect for balance and quality. Our beer is handcrafted with specific attention paid to the sources of our ingredients. We do not restrict our beer to guidelines and rules, but brew for the love of the craft and our customers. From the novice to the expert connoisseur, we view our patrons as our friends and aim to provide an open, carefree environment for all to enjoy. We are Colorado natives, family owned, and pursue the happiness in life one fantastic beer at a time.

data.name: Renegade Brewing Company
data.hoursOfOperation: Tours on Fridays and Saturdays starting January 16, 2015

brewery.name: Renegade Brewing Company
brewery.description:
Offensively Delicious? Yes, that’s what our beer is. Always creative and always packed with flavor. This is beer for those who do the don’ts and don’t the dos, the Renegades. We don’t care about traditional styles, or following the trends, we care about making f’ing delicious beer that we are proud to serve.

Renegade was founded by Brian and Khara O’Connell in the summer of 2011 in the Santa Fe Arts District of Denver. Brian brought his offensively delicious brews, developed in his backyard, to Denverites to encourage social interaction and friendship.  Come down to our taproom, or ask for us at your favorite bar, restaurant or liquor store. Whatever you do, don’t be something you’re not.Be Renegade.

brewery.name: Blue Moon Brewing Company
brewery.description: At Blue Moon Brewing Company®, we believe brewing is an art. And it’s been that way since our head brewmaster and founder, Keith Villa, first created Blue Moon® Belgian White Belgian-Style Wheat Ale back in 1995 in downtown Denver, Colorado.

brewery.name: Fiction Beer Company
brewery.description: Ryan and Christa Kilpatrick plan to combine their love of good books and good beer at Fiction Beer Company, which they'll open on the first floor of the Phoenix on the Fax apartment building in east Denver, a part of town that is desperately lacking in craft breweries.  Fiction will include a seven-barrel brewing system, six beers on tap and a patio out back.  The beer styles will be categorized into genres based on the couple's favorite works of fiction, including classics, like an IPA; mystery and adventure; and fantasy/sci-fi.  Opening July, 2014

data.name: Stem Ciders
data.hoursOfOperation:
Wed–Thu: 4pm–10pm
Fri: 4pm–11pm
Sat: Noon–11pm
Sun: Noon–6pm

brewery.name: Stem Ciders
brewery.description: At Stem Ciders, we are committed to creating ciders of the highest quality that honor the purity and complexity that is inherent to the apple. We can’t wait to introduce you to your perfect cider match. We are dedicated to reviving the cider tradition, which goes far beyond what you enjoy in your glass. We hold our growers in the highest regard, and by fostering relationships with them we reward their hard work and promote the regrowth of heirloom apple cultivation. We love our home-base in Denver, and embrace the Colorado lifestyle that makes us lug a bottle to share up a mountain to enjoy a drink with a view. Most importantly, we love nothing more than seeing that smile on your face when you have your first sip of one of our crisp, refreshing ciders.

brewery.name: EPIC Brewing Company
brewery.description:
EPIC Brewing Company opened in May 2010 with six fermentation tanks, but an increase in space and brewing capacity has given brewers the flexibility to create beers that have yet to be imagined. Epic has doubled is capacity twice in the past three years and in the summer of 2013 opened an additional brewery in Denver, CO.  

In only a few short months after opening, Epic began earning medals for its beers domestically and internationally. Now brewing over 35 distinctly different beers we believe there is an Epic brew for your tastes, at the right place and the right time. At Epic, everyone is here to help you make the perfect beer match.

data.name: The Ale House at Amato's,  Denver

brewery.name: Breckenridge Brewery
brewery.description: Breckenridge Brewery was founded in 1990 in Breckenridge, Colorado. In the past two plus decades Breckenridge Brewery has grown from a small 3,000-barrels-a-year brewpub to one of the most successful craft beer and restaurant companies in the nation. It now handcrafts more than 70,000 barrels of fresh beer annually and owns and operates five brewpubs and ale houses in the state of Colorado. For more information visit www.breckbrew.com.

brewery.name: Mountain Sun Brewery
brewery.description: "Hippies, mountain bikers, and locals flock here for some of Boulder's best microbrews. The low-priced, healthy fare includes massive mixed-green salads, big burritos and even non-garden-variety burgers, like the Black and Blue burger, with blue cheese and blackened seasoning. The Junk burger is loaded with everything in the kitchen. Drink options include the coffee-alcohol Java Porter, or the XXX Pale Ale, a hoppy brew with flavor and bite."

data.name: Yak & Yeti Restaurant and Event Center

brewery.name: Yak & Yeti Brewpub
brewery.description:
The Yak and Yeti Brewpub is located in Olde Town Arvada and resides in an 1864 haunted Victorian brick mansion. Our 7 barrel brewhouse can be seen from the lobby near the bar. 

All our beers are handcrafted by our brewmaster, Adam Draeger. Seasonals beers are released monthly and sometimes weekly. Stop by for pint of craft beer or take home a growler today.

brewery.name: Zephyr Brewing Co
brewery.description: Located in RiNo, this small but trendy craft brewery loves beer, sports, and games as much as you!  Located just 4 blocks from Coors Field, this taproom is a great pre/post-game location.  They also host weekly trivia games, monthly comedy shows, monthly poker games, painting events, and much  more!
